intro: Macrocarpaea quelchii, commonly known as the Kauri macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are dark green and leathery, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Macrocarpaea quelchii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
